description.narrative: Farmers' market ? Enhancing Access to Profitable Markets Project (2012?2014) improves small-scale farmers' income security in the three communities in rural Zambia by providing them with business skills knowledge and means. The project responds for challen ges the farmers living in rural areas are facing when trying to get living by their livelihood. The project has included Market Research Negotiation skills Transportation and Market Financing. Though clear improvements and progress in the marketing skills and knowledge among the farmers have been achieved some challenges have been identified during the project. Challenges have consisted the inadequate entrepreneurship and financial management skills low utilization of donkeys and lack of the local governanc e of the Marketing Committees. There is a need for the continuation project and supplement of the activities to attain the full sustainability of the project. The main objective of the continuation project is to strengthen the local communities by providin g additional skills knowledge and support to farmers. The main activities suggested for the continuation project are the trainings in entrepreneurship financial management and negotiation skills familiarizing communities more with the utilization and manag ement of donkeys creating business agreements with the buyers and developing governance and operational guidelines for the Marketing Committees.
